content:
• Thursday, June 30, 2011
  • OSK

    Vehicle specialist Oshkosh (NYSE:OSK) up 8.3% AH after Carl Icahn files that he's taken a 9.5%...

    Vehicle specialist Oshkosh (NYSE:OSK) up 8.3% AH after Carl Icahn files that he's taken a 9.5% stake in the "undervalued" company - joining other key owners like SAC Capital and George Soros - and he's ready to have a talk with management about unlocking that value ...
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • DNDN

    Dendreon's (NASDAQ:DNDN) advanced prostate cancer drug Provenge is approved for coverage by...

    Dendreon's (NASDAQ:DNDN) advanced prostate cancer drug Provenge is approved for coverage by Medicare and Medicaid. The drug is the first FDA-approved immunotherapy for prostate cancer to receive Medicare coverage. DNDN +3.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • CF

    A number of agriculture stocks underperformed in the aftermath of the USDA's unappetizing corn...

    A number of agriculture stocks underperformed in the aftermath of the USDA's unappetizing corn report. CF -5.1%. AGU -0.5%. MOS -1%. DE flat.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) +2.7% AH, adding to a 2.4% gain, after reporting record 4Q sales of...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) +2.7% AH, adding to a 2.4% gain, after reporting record 4Q sales of $111.8M (+7.7% Y/Y). The firm issues downside guidance on Q1 revenues, but says "efforts have centered on reducing costs as well as developing and deploying new products to address broader customer requirements."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • SPR

    After delaying non-essential aircraft maintenance for nearly three years, airlines are now...

    After delaying non-essential aircraft maintenance for nearly three years, airlines are now forced to ramp-up on neglected retro-fitting and overhauls. This should benefit aftermarket servicers like Spirit Aerosytems (SPR +3.5%), TransDigm (TDG +2.6%), Johnson Controls (JCI +0.8%), and GE +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • UTX

    United Technologies (UTX +2.3%) gains after saying its Pratt & Whitney unit will collaborate...

    United Technologies (UTX +2.3%) gains after saying its Pratt & Whitney unit will collaborate with Korean Air (OTC:KRNRF) to build a $112M maintenance center at Incheon airport, near Seoul.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ARW

    Deutsche Bank's Sherri Scribner is turning bullish on tech distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW...

    Deutsche Bank's Sherri Scribner is turning bullish on tech distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW +4.3%) and contract manufacturers Celestica (CLS +6.7%) and Plexus (PLXS +2.5%), upgrading all three to Buy. If Scribner is vindicated, that's a positive for tech in general, since dozens of chip and hardware vendors are tied to these firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • SPRD

    Muddy Waters' Carson Block hints he may be wrong on Spreadtrum (SPRD +14%), saying if “we...

    Muddy Waters' Carson Block hints he may be wrong on Spreadtrum (SPRD +14%), saying if “we misinterpreted these points as red flags, then the company’s transparency has improved and the stock is going to go up.” Investors may have already figured it out - the stock has jumped 26% over the past two sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (ACI +4.4%) shares gain a day after an announcement from competitor Consol Energy (CNX...

    Arch Coal (ACI +4.4%) shares gain a day after an announcement from competitor Consol Energy (CNX +0.9%) it's closing a non-producing mine, and taking a $84M pre-tax chargeoff.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks (TAN +2.8%) show solid gains as an earlier report on DOE loan guarantees for First...

    Solar stocks (TAN +2.8%) show solid gains as an earlier report on DOE loan guarantees for First Solar (FSLR +4.1%) spills over and lifts select solar companies. Gainers: SPWRA +5.8%, TSL +3.7%, STP +1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +5.9%) shares retake their pre-IPO price after the company announces its first...

    Pandora (P +5.9%) shares retake their pre-IPO price after the company announces its first analyst day July 12. The timing, coinciding with the end of its quiet period, could act as a catalyst for further positive comments from analysts. The firm faces stiff competition, but can justify its $2.9B market cap if it grows subscribers and opens new revenue streams, says one report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -9.1%) shares plummet on news of a lawsuit accusing the software maker of inflating...

    Ebix (EBIX -9.1%) shares plummet on news of a lawsuit accusing the software maker of inflating earnings by overstating accounts receivable. The overstatement allegedly occurred in Q4 2009, representing 1.7% of Ebix’s net income.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home's (KBH -3.1%) improving fundamentals seem to "have evaporated, and we do not see a...

    KB Home's (KBH -3.1%) improving fundamentals seem to "have evaporated, and we do not see a strong roadmap to recovery," Ticonderoga says, downgrading shares to Neutral. Yesterday's 15% plunge was stoked by management signalling a possible shortage of cash, pointing to a need for greater focus on "profitability and the balance sheet, with less emphasis on growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CORT

    Corcept Therapeutics (CORT -8.7%) sinks on heavy volume, despite regulators accepting its...

    Corcept Therapeutics (CORT -8.7%) sinks on heavy volume, despite regulators accepting its application to market Corlux as a treatment for Cushing's Syndrome. After final approval, Corcept will have seven years to market the drug exclusively.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP +4.4%), which is currently hosting its analyst day, has seen its shares jump during...

    NetApp (NTAP +4.4%), which is currently hosting its analyst day, has seen its shares jump during the last hour. StreetInsider.com is reporting that the company set an FY12 EPS guidance range of $2.46-$2.64, which compares favorably with a consensus estimate of $2.48.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • F

    Ford (F +3.8%) bets on South Africa with a $500M upgrade of its Pretoria facility to produce the...

    Ford (F +3.8%) bets on South Africa with a $500M upgrade of its Pretoria facility to produce the Ranger pickup. The plant upgrade will boost vehicle production to 110K from 48K, to help sell primarily in Asia and Africa. Ford is looking at global markets to help meet its goal of a 50% sales increase by 2015, says an executive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO -0.6%) shares turn lower on news that police in China have detained 36 people as...

    Yahoo (YHOO -0.6%) shares turn lower on news that police in China have detained 36 people as part of an ongoing investigation of fraud at Alibaba.com, of which Yahoo owns a 40% stake. Shares had been higher following Needham's recommendation, which noted that YHOO is "well-positioned to solve several of the biggest issues slowing monetization of the Web."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • HNSN

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +13.0%) shares are off to the races on account of Piper Jaffray upgrading...

    Hansen Medical (HNSN +13.0%) shares are off to the races on account of Piper Jaffray upgrading the stock from Neutral to Overweight. Piper also raised its PT on Hansen from $3 to $5.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • Grain futures are getting pummeled in wake of the bearish USDA report. New crop wheat futures...

    Grain futures are getting pummeled in wake of the bearish USDA report. New crop wheat futures are off 7.4%, and corn might be down just as much if not for price limits. Beans are spared the worst of the carnage. JJG -6.6%, CORN -8.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • LYSCF

    Shares of rare earth companies soar after reports a competitor's large refinery in Malaysia...

    Shares of rare earth companies soar after reports a competitor's large refinery in Malaysia faces problems. The Australian Stock Exchange halted trading yesterday on Lynas Corp. (OTCPK:LYSCF -8.8%) in advance of a news conference outlining its safety issues. Gainers: MCP +6.2%, REE +3.9%, AVL +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • BAC

    "The worst decision we ever made," says a BofA (BAC -1.8%) director of the board's attempt to...

    "The worst decision we ever made," says a BofA (BAC -1.8%) director of the board's attempt to catch a falling knife with the Countrywide purchase - saddling the lender with $17B in losses to this point. In a ripping market, BAC is down again, giving up yesterday's settlement-related gains. Caveat emptor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 3 Comments
  • USNA

    USANA Health Sciences (USNA +14.3%) pops the morning after releasing strong preliminary 2Q...

    USANA Health Sciences (USNA +14.3%) pops the morning after releasing strong preliminary 2Q results. The firm expects to beat estimates, helped by the purchase last year of China's BabyCare Ltd., seeing EPS $0.85 vs. $0.71 on sales of $147M vs. $135M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • RBCN

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +2.9%), which makes sapphire wafers for LED chip production,...

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +2.9%), which makes sapphire wafers for LED chip production, are getting a lift on J.P. Morgan's remarks that concerns over GT Solar's (SOLR) strong sapphire manufacturing equipment orders are overblown. On Monday, DigiTimes forecasted major sapphire price declines in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM

  • Currency intervention? The greenback explodes higher about 0.5% vs. the Swiss franc in the past...

    Currency intervention? The greenback explodes higher about 0.5% vs. the Swiss franc in the past few minutes. One swissie now buying $1.1936.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • The grain markets could be in for a nasty move today following the USDA's crop acreage report...

    The grain markets could be in for a nasty move today following the USDA's crop acreage report showing higher than expected plantings this year. The amount projected to be harvested is greater than market anticipation as well. JJG  -3.1%, CORN -3.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 3 Comments
  • HAFC

    Premarket gainers: HAFC +26%. LYG +8%. HNSN +8%. FSLR +6%. RENN +4%. VVUS +4%. EBAY +4%. RAD...

    Premarket gainers: HAFC +26%. LYG +8%. HNSN +8%. FSLR +6%. RENN +4%. VVUS +4%. EBAY +4%. RAD +3%. SKT +3%. SPIL +3%. MCP +3%.
    Losers: CTIC -13%. AEZS -5%. CIGX -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) +4.2% premarket after BofA and Citigroup upgrade to Buy as rules on debit...

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) +4.2% premarket after BofA and Citigroup upgrade to Buy as rules on debit interchange fees clarify. Jefferies' Youssef Squali says PayPal largely will not be affected by the new cap rules, and stands to save $74M-$96M in processing costs it can use to improve its competitive advantage.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • RAD

    Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) same-store sales +1.8% in June. Total drugstore sales +1% to $1.928B. Shares...

    Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) same-store sales +1.8% in June. Total drugstore sales +1% to $1.928B. Shares +1.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • DNDN

    The FDA approves Dendreon's (NASDAQ:DNDN) Los Angeles cancer immunotherapy manufacturing...

    The FDA approves Dendreon's (NASDAQ:DNDN) Los Angeles cancer immunotherapy manufacturing facility, allowing it to increase production of its blockbuster prostate cancer drug Provenge. Shares +3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) jumps 6.8% premarket to $138.22 on reports the Department of Energy...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) jumps 6.8% premarket to $138.22 on reports the Department of Energy will announce $4.5B in loan guarantees for three California solar projects. The stock was also initiated with a Positive and a $160 price target at Avian Securities, while Notable Calls thinks the stock will trade in the $140-145 range today on the DoE news.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • RBS

    RBS (RBS +3.9%) is ticking higher on reports it may be nearing a deal to sell its Aussie unit to...

    RBS (RBS +3.9%) is ticking higher on reports it may be nearing a deal to sell its Aussie unit to MUFG (MTU).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • LYG

    Lloyds (NYSE:LYG) will substantially reduce its international presence and cut another 15,000...

    Lloyds (NYSE:LYG) will substantially reduce its international presence and cut another 15,000 jobs, with the aim of saving $2.4B a year by 2014. Expectations for 2011 remain unchanged, as revenue is set to fall but so are costs and impairments. Shares +5.1% in London. (Lloyd's strategic review)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 AM | 1 Comment
